decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed change of use to mixed use of C1/C3 would result in the loss of permanent housing, adversely impacting on housing choice and delivery of housing in Merton and London, contrary to Policies H1, H8 and H9 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies H11.1 and H11.2 of the Merton Local Plan 2024 - 2037/38

Reason : 2 - The applicant has failed to demonstrate that the potential long term use as short term rented accommodation would not result in noise disturbance to neighbouring properties, in conflict with Policies D3 and D14 of the London Plan and Policies D12.2 and P15.10 of the Merton Local Plan 2024 - 2037/38

Reason : 3 - The applicant has failed to demonstrate that the proposed development would meet the minimum internal water efficiency standard of 105 litres per person per day, in conflict with Policy CC2.6 of the Merton Local Plan 2024 - 2037/38.

Reason : 4 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted. 
"	The applicant was informed of any issues arising during consideration of the application. 
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict.
